title: Car rolls and bursts into flames on notorious Sydney road as residents call for new safety measures
text:
A P-plate driver has rolled a car with four young passengers inside it before the vehicle burst into flames on a notorious road in Sydney.

The 18-year-old driver hit the front fence of a property on River Road in Greenwich, which flipped the car onto its roof on the street after 1am on Monday.

The occupants of the Mitsubishi Magna were able to escape the vehicle before it caught alight, with firefighters called in to put out the flames.

A P-plate driver has rolled a car (pictured) filled with four young passengers before it burst into flames on a notorious road in Sydney

Passengers were taken to Royal North Shore Hospital suffering minor injuries, while the driver was breath tested on site and blew a negative result.

River Road residents have witnessed a number of incident on their street, with the most recent occurring on Sunday, when a driver hit road signs on the side of the road.

'It happens all the time,' a resident told 9news. 'I hear 'boom, boom, boom', and you just wait for that last crash.'

'We ran out and we saw the car upside down and five people sitting on the side of the road, amazingly still alive.'

A motorcyclist has been killed here before, with residents wanting speed cameras installed on the street.

'You're worried about what you're going to find when you walk out the door,' the resident said.
